instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message:
got a 2850 with green light, check system info and battery not being detected. it will run off the battery, and i have voltage on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> have 3.39v pin 1 and 3.38volts on 2 its the same for both. and every spot it shows up on the board i checked.  res is good 1.746 in diode mode. 

also i checked a second battery already so that has been ruled out.  

would this be the smc? i checked the isl and res on 17-18 and 27-28 is good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: Disconnect battery indicator to rule that out. After that it will be SMC or <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> or both.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: okay smc was the problem.  changed it out and have an orange light.  also was wondering if this supplier is good or if you have one you are willing to recommend for smc chips.  i need 4 chips and only have 3 donor boads instock. also for the price seemed great for pre balled chips whats your take?  [url]http://www.ebay.com/itm/181100617512[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: I bought some from this seller and none works, i prefer to buy complete donor boards, this way im sure where SMC came from .......... Of course there is a chance that SMC dont work, for me and till now, all came in good working conditions...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: Of course they won't work, need to take from IDENTICAL donor board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message:
i'm not sure my Question was understood correctly,  I am aware the smc is Identical to each board number,  i checked the smc and i need the F2117LP20H V for a stack of the Same model boards i have on the shelf.   wondering if this supplier is selling legit chips.  But aprendiz said he bought from them and none works,  I assume you were trying to put them onto the right board model? 

I buy donor boards just don't feel like buying $200 of one model donor boards for $10-20 in smc chips.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: I'm not sure you understand. All SMCs have the same part number, just the firmware is different and no way to tell on the outside which board they came from. New ones will of course never work cause they are blank.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message:
oh, i was looking at other boards and saw the number on the smc is different.  do the speeds of the board also matter? 2.4 2.5 2.6 2.8? or do they just need to be the same board number so <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will work for all <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>'s?  I understand now what your saying about the chips could be from any computer/device that was using that smc chip so the firmware is not going to be right. i have not found that smc number on any other donor boards  i have in house so was thrown off i guess.  
 i will just have to buy a stack of  donor boards.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: also we can mark this as solved.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: Board number needs to match, that is all.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not recognize battery
threads.message: okay cool that's what i have always thought. Thanks Duke!
